CRUD Operations Testing Checklist

Branch: patch/fix-schema-mismatch-and-crud
Date: 2025-11-13
Purpose: Comprehensive end-to-end testing to catch all schema mismatches and CRUD bugs

‚úÖ Fixed Issues

Bug #4: Feedback Submission Schema Mismatch

  • Status: ‚úÖ Fixed
  • File: FeedbackModal.tsx
  • Issue: Trying to insert user_email and user_name columns that don‚Äôt exist in production
  • Fix: Removed non-existent columns from insert operation
  • Test: Submit feedback and verify no 400 errors

üîç Components to Test

1. Feedback System ‚úÖ FIXED

Component: FeedbackModal.tsx

Test Steps: - [ ] Open Feedback Modal - [ ] Select feedback type (Bug/Feature/Idea) - [ ] Fill in title (min 5 chars) - [ ] Fill in description (min 10 chars) - [ ] Select category - [ ] Click Submit - [ ] Verify success message - [ ] Check database for new record - [ ] Verify no console errors

Expected Behavior: - Feedback should be created with: user_id, type, title, description, category, status - No 400 errors about missing columns - Success notification appears

2. Learning Catalog Management ‚ö†Ô∏è NEEDS VERIFICATION

Component: LearningCatalogManager.tsx

Tables Used: learning_items (marked as any)

Test Steps: - [ ] Open Learning Catalog - [ ] Click ‚ÄúAdd Item‚Äù - [ ] Fill in: title, description, issuer, type, duration, difficulty, URL, tags - [ ] Click Save - [ ] Verify item appears in list - [ ] Edit an existing item - [ ] Delete an item - [ ] Test CSV import - [ ] Test CSV export

Schema Check:

-- Verify these columns exist in production:
SELECT column_name FROM information_schema.columns 
WHERE table_name = 'learning_items';

Expected Columns: - id, title, description, issuer, type, duration_hours, url, tags, difficulty_level, is_preset

3. Completed Learning Management ‚ö†Ô∏è NEEDS VERIFICATION

Component: CompletedLearningManager.tsx

Tables Used: user_learning, user_learning_detailed, learning_items (all marked as any)

Test Steps: - [ ] Open user profile - [ ] Navigate to Completed Learning tab - [ ] Click ‚ÄúAdd Learning‚Äù - [ ] Select from catalog OR enter custom - [ ] Fill in: title, issuer, completion date, evidence URL, notes, tags, skills - [ ] Click Save - [ ] Verify entry appears - [ ] Edit an entry - [ ] Delete an entry - [ ] Check duplicate warning works

Schema Check:

-- Verify these tables and columns exist:
SELECT table_name FROM information_schema.tables 
WHERE table_name IN ('user_learning', 'user_learning_detailed', 'learning_items');

4. Project Reviews ‚ö†Ô∏è NEEDS VERIFICATION

Component: ProjectReviewModal.tsx

Tables Used: project_reviews (marked as any)

Test Steps: - [ ] Complete a project - [ ] Open project review modal - [ ] Rate: quality (1-5), business impact (1-5), innovation (1-5) - [ ] Enter actual ROI - [ ] Add lessons learned - [ ] Click Submit - [ ] Verify review is saved - [ ] Edit existing review - [ ] Verify update works

Schema Check:

-- Verify project_reviews table exists with these columns:
SELECT column_name FROM information_schema.columns 
WHERE table_name = 'project_reviews';

Expected Columns: - id, project_id, quality_rating, business_impact_rating, innovation_score, actual_roi, lessons_learned, reviewed_by, reviewed_at

5. Career Paths & Invitations ‚ö†Ô∏è NEEDS VERIFICATION

Component: AmbitionsTab.tsx

Tables Used: career_paths, user_path_preferences, project_invitations (all marked as any)

Test Steps:

Career Paths:

Invitations:

Schema Check:

-- Verify these tables exist:
SELECT table_name FROM information_schema.tables 
WHERE table_name IN ('career_paths', 'user_path_preferences', 'project_invitations');

6. Leadership Dashboard ‚ö†Ô∏è NEEDS VERIFICATION

Component: LeadershipTab.tsx

Tables Used: user_performance (marked as any)

Test Steps:

Performance Rating:

Pipeline Stage:

Schema Check:

-- Verify user_performance table exists:
SELECT column_name FROM information_schema.columns 
WHERE table_name = 'user_performance';

Expected Columns: - id, user_id, performance_rating, pipeline_stage, rated_at

üîß Migration Status

Applied to Production:

  • ‚úÖ Basic tables (users, projects, ambitions, etc.)
  • ‚úÖ Skills management tables
  • ‚úÖ Project invitations tables

NOT Applied to Production (Potential Issues):

  • ‚ö†Ô∏è learning_items table
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è user_learning table
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è user_learning_detailed view
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è project_reviews table
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è career_paths table
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è user_path_preferences table
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è user_performance table

üìã Testing Priority

High Priority (Test First):

  1. ‚úÖ Feedback Submission - Already fixed
  2. Learning Catalog - Used by admins for course management
  3. Completed Learning - Used by all users for profile
  4. Project Reviews - Used by leaders for project completion

Medium Priority:

  1. Career Paths - Used by interns for career planning
  2. Invitations - Used by leaders and interns
  3. Performance Rating - Used by leaders for talent management

üö® Common Schema Issues to Check

1. Column Name Mismatches

  • Code uses user_email but DB has email
  • Code uses candidate_name but DB has name

2. Missing Tables

  • Code references table that doesn‚Äôt exist in production
  • Migration file exists but not applied

3. Type Mismatches

  • Code sends string but DB expects integer
  • Code sends array but DB expects JSON

4. Required vs Optional

  • Code doesn‚Äôt provide required field
  • Code provides field that doesn‚Äôt exist

üìù How to Test

For Each Component:

  1. Read the migration file (if it exists)

    • Check what columns are defined
    • Note any constraints or defaults

  2. Check production database

    -- List all tables
SELECT table_name FROM information_schema.tables 
WHERE table_schema = 'public';

-- Check specific table columns
SELECT column_name, data_type, is_nullable 
FROM information_schema.columns 
WHERE table_name = 'your_table_name';

  3. Test the UI

    • Follow test steps above
    • Watch browser console for errors
    • Check network tab for 400/500 errors

  4. Verify database

    • Check if record was created/updated/deleted
    • Verify data matches what was submitted

‚úÖ Success Criteria

üêõ If You Find Issues

  1. Document the error
    • Screenshot of error message
    • Browser console logs
    • Network request/response
  2. Check the schema
    • Compare code expectations vs actual DB schema
    • Look for migration files
  3. Fix the code
    • Remove non-existent columns (like we did for feedback)
    • Add missing columns to migration
    • Update types to match DB
  4. Test again
    • Verify fix works
    • Check for side effects
